trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Juniper MX:ifOperStatus[{#SNMPVALUE}].avg(7200)}<2 and {Template Juniper MX:ifOperStatus[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()}=2 and {Template Juniper MX:ifAlias[{#SNMPVALUE}].str(this_does_not_exist)}=0
trigger_prototype.name: Interface status on {HOST.HOST}: {#SNMPVALUE}, {ITEM.VALUE2} : {ITEM.VALUE3}
trigger_prototype.description: Interface status went up to down !!! Interface : {#SNMPVALUE}, {ITEM.VALUE1} = {ITEM.VALUE3}

trigger_prototype.name: {HOSTNAME} {#SNMPVALUE} - CPU Usage above 80%
trigger_prototype.description:
Active Investigation recommended if increase is sudden or sustained on upper range and load average is also > 100
Disable traceoptions Clean up storage Verify system processes

trigger_prototype.name: {HOSTNAME} {#SNMPVALUE} - High CPU Usage (95%)
trigger_prototype.description:
Device responsiveness for self traffic is likely to be impacted
Disable traceoptions Clean up storage Verify system processes

trigger_prototype.name: {HOSTNAME} {#SNMPVALUE} - Hight temperature
trigger_prototype.description: Check status of Fans Check ambient temperature and device spacing requirements

trigger_prototype.name: {HOSTNAME} {#SNMPVALUE} - Memory Usage above 70%
trigger_prototype.description: Verify routing table size Verify System Processes in use Review system logs

trigger_prototype.name: {HOSTNAME} {#SNMPVALUE} - Memory Usage above 95%
trigger_prototype.description: Verify routing table size Verify System Processes in use Review system logs

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Juniper MX:jnxBgpM2PeerRemoteAs[{#ASNUM}, {#PEERADDR}].regexp({$BGP_PEER_AS})}=0 and {Template Juniper MX:jnxBgpM2PeerState[{#ASNUM}, {#PEERADDR}].last()}=6 and {Template Juniper MX:jnxBgpM2PrefixOutPrefixes[{#ASNUM}, {#PEERADDR}].last()}<0.8*{Template Juniper MX:jnxBgpM2PrefixOutPrefixes[{#ASNUM}, {#PEERADDR}].avg(86400)}
trigger_prototype.name: {HOSTNAME} BGP AS{#ASNUM} peer {#PEERADDR} has lost more than 20% of advertising prefixes

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Juniper MX:jnxBgpM2PeerRemoteAs[{#ASNUM}, {#PEERADDR}].regexp({$BGP_PEER_AS})}=1 and {Template Juniper MX:jnxBgpM2PeerState[{#ASNUM}, {#PEERADDR}].last()}=6 and {Template Juniper MX:jnxBgpM2PrefixOutPrefixes[{#ASNUM}, {#PEERADDR}].last()}<0.8*{Template Juniper MX:jnxBgpM2PrefixOutPrefixes[{#ASNUM}, {#PEERADDR}].avg(86400)}
trigger_prototype.name: {HOSTNAME} BGP AS{#ASNUM} peer {#PEERADDR} has lost more than 20% of advertising prefixes

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Juniper MX:jnxBgpM2PeerRemoteAs[{#ASNUM}, {#PEERADDR}].regexp({$BGP_PEER_AS})}=0 and {Template Juniper MX:jnxBgpM2PeerState[{#ASNUM}, {#PEERADDR}].last()}=6 and {Template Juniper MX:jnxBgpM2PrefixInPrefixesAccepted[{#ASNUM}, {#PEERADDR}].last()}<0.8*{Template Juniper MX:jnxBgpM2PrefixInPrefixesAccepted[{#ASNUM}, {#PEERADDR}].avg(86400)}
trigger_prototype.name: {HOSTNAME} BGP AS{#ASNUM} peer {#PEERADDR} has lost more than 20% of receiving prefixes

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Juniper MX:jnxBgpM2PeerRemoteAs[{#ASNUM}, {#PEERADDR}].regexp({$BGP_PEER_AS})}=1 and {Template Juniper MX:jnxBgpM2PeerState[{#ASNUM}, {#PEERADDR}].last()}=6 and {Template Juniper MX:jnxBgpM2PrefixInPrefixesAccepted[{#ASNUM}, {#PEERADDR}].last()}<0.8*{Template Juniper MX:jnxBgpM2PrefixInPrefixesAccepted[{#ASNUM}, {#PEERADDR}].avg(86400)}
trigger_prototype.name: {HOSTNAME} BGP AS{#ASNUM} peer {#PEERADDR} has lost more than 20% of receiving prefixes

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Juniper MX:jnxBgpM2PeerRemoteAs[{#ASNUM}, {#PEERADDR}].regexp({$BGP_PEER_AS})}=0 and {Template Juniper MX:jnxBgpM2PeerState[{#ASNUM}, {#PEERADDR}].last(#3)}<>6 and {Template Juniper MX:jnxBgpM2PeerStatus[{#ASNUM}, {#PEERADDR}].last(0)}=2
trigger_prototype.name: {HOSTNAME} BGP AS{#ASNUM} peer {#PEERADDR} is DOWN
trigger_prototype.description: Trigger for peer that has a remote AS not matching {$BGP_PEER_AS} macro.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Juniper MX:jnxBgpM2PeerRemoteAs[{#ASNUM}, {#PEERADDR}].regexp({$BGP_PEER_AS})}=1 and {Template Juniper MX:jnxBgpM2PeerState[{#ASNUM}, {#PEERADDR}].last(#3)}<>6 and {Template Juniper MX:jnxBgpM2PeerStatus[{#ASNUM}, {#PEERADDR}].last(0)}=2
trigger_prototype.name: {HOSTNAME} BGP AS{#ASNUM} peer {#PEERADDR} is DOWN
trigger_prototype.description: Trigger for peer that has a remote AS matching {$BGP_PEER_AS} macro.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Juniper MX:jnxBgpM2PeerRemoteAs[{#ASNUM}, {#PEERADDR}].regexp({$BGP_PEER_AS})}=0 and {Template Juniper MX:jnxBgpM2PeerState[{#ASNUM}, {#PEERADDR}].last()}=6 and {Template Juniper MX:jnxBgpM2PrefixInPrefixes[{#ASNUM}, {#PEERADDR}].last()}=0
trigger_prototype.name: {HOSTNAME} No prefixes received for AS{#ASNUM} peer {#PEERADDR}

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Juniper MX:jnxBgpM2PeerRemoteAs[{#ASNUM}, {#PEERADDR}].regexp({$BGP_PEER_AS})}=1 and {Template Juniper MX:jnxBgpM2PeerState[{#ASNUM}, {#PEERADDR}].last()}=6 and {Template Juniper MX:jnxBgpM2PrefixInPrefixes[{#ASNUM}, {#PEERADDR}].last()}=0
trigger_prototype.name: {HOSTNAME} No prefixes received for AS{#ASNUM} peer {#PEERADDR}

trigger.expression: {Template Juniper MX:icmpping.sum(#3)}=0 or ({TRIGGER.VALUE}=1 and {Template Juniper MX:icmpping.sum(#3)}<>3)
trigger.name: Ping check

mapping.newvalue: Receive Unexpected Message in OpenSent State
Receive Unexpected Message in OpenConfirm State
Receive Unexpected Message in Established State
